answers.answer: I am wondering the same thing. I have my 34 week appointment next Tuesday and I am going to ask all the questions. Right now he is clocking in at 4 lbs 10 oz at 32 weeks and another girl at work is 36 weeks and her daughter is at 4 lbs 9 oz lol
My doctor won't induce early unless you have gestational diabetes. Otherwise tge only way she will induce is if you are a week late.

I'm sort of in the same boat. I'm measuring weeks ahead on babies size as well as carrying extra fluid.... And she's breech. I don't even want to try to give birth to that at term. Doctors are monitoring my growth every week but haven't told me any possible outcomes yet.
How are your doctors monitoring the babys growth?
Some measure belly and other do ultrasounds

In most states u have to be at least 1 cm dilated to get induced so that would be the 1st indicator to ask about.10lb is not abnormal nor is it impossible to deliver vaginally.C section recovery is worse than vaginal delivery ....even if u need stiches!Just because the baby is big (ger) doesn't mean u have to get induced .

I am 31 weeks with twins and they are over 4 lbs. They both have room.. I am waiting to have my c section at 38 weeks. I am high risk and still work and highly doubt that I'll have them in the next fee weeks
I'm getting ultrasounds to measure the waters and baby size, if I get too big or too much and go into labor I could run risks.

Ultrasound measurements can be off by a pound or more either way. Most likely your body can birth any baby that you carry. If you have Gestational diabetes you might make a baby to big for your pelvis but if you control your diet you wouldnt. Our bodies are made to fit a baby through the pelvis and birth canal.

question: I will be getting an ultrasound at my 36 week appointment (next week) to determine the size of the baby. Everytime I do an ultrasound, they always mention how big she is. ( her femur measures 2-3 weeks ahead)Will they induce me early if baby is too big? Or can I ask to be induced early because she is too big?I want to deliver vaginaly, but if she's close to 10lbs, I'm going to be open for a c-section. The bigger my belly gets, the more afraid I am to give birth lolAny experiences with this??
title: Does a big baby, mean being induced early?
